# 🛡️ Multi-Persona Compliance Dashboard

**Real-time compliance visibility for Compliance Officers, Security Officers, and Cloud Engineers**

This dashboard provides role-specific views of your Azure environment's compliance posture, security status, and operational health. Use the parameters below to customize the view for your subscription and resource scope.

---

parameters.name: Subscriptions
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat('/subscriptions/', subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = true

parameters.name: ResourceGroups
parameters.query:
Resources
| distinct resourceGroup
| order by resourceGroup asc
| project value = resourceGroup, label = resourceGroup

parameters.name: EnvironmentTag
parameters.query:
Resources
| where isnotempty(tags["Environment"])
| distinct tostring(tags["Environment"])
| order by tags_Environment asc
| project value = tags_Environment, label = tags_Environment

content.json:
## 🏛️ Compliance Officer Dashboard

**Focus: Regulatory adherence, risk management, and audit preparation**

This section provides executive-level compliance visibility with key metrics, policy compliance status, and audit-ready reporting capabilities.

**📊 Overall Compliance Posture**

This metric shows your organization's compliance percentage based on Azure Policy evaluations. The percentage represents how many of your resources are compliant with assigned policies divided by total evaluated resources. A higher percentage indicates better adherence to your governance standards.

- **Target**: Maintain >90% compliance
- **Green**: 85%+ (Good governance)
- **Yellow**: 70-85% (Needs attention)
- **Red**: <70% (Immediate action required)

content.query:
PolicyResources
| where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates"
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| summarize 
    TotalResources = count(),
    CompliantCount = countif(complianceState == "Compliant"),
    NonCompliantCount = countif(complianceState == "NonCompliant")
| extend CompliancePercentage = round((CompliantCount * 100.0) / TotalResources, 1)
| project CompliancePercentage, CompliantCount, NonCompliantCount, TotalResources
content.title: Compliance Overview

content.query:
PolicyResources
| where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates"
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| summarize 
    CompliantCount = countif(complianceState == "Compliant")
| project CompliantCount
content.title: Compliant Resources

content.query:
PolicyResources
| where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates"
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| summarize 
    NonCompliantCount = countif(complianceState == "NonCompliant")
| project NonCompliantCount
content.title: Non-Compliant Resources

content.json:
**📈 Policy Initiative Compliance Status**

This chart displays compliance rates for each Policy Initiative (also called Policy Sets) assigned to your environment. Each bar represents a different initiative, with the percentage showing how many resources comply with that specific set of policies.

- **CIS Benchmarks**: Industry security standards
- **Regulatory Compliance**: Legal/regulatory requirements
- **Corporate Standards**: Internal governance policies

Lower percentages indicate initiatives requiring immediate remediation focus.

content.query:
PolicyResources
| where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates"
| extend 
    complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState),
    policySetDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId)
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| summarize 
    CompliantResources = countif(complianceState == "Compliant"),
    NonCompliantResources = countif(complianceState == "NonCompliant"),
    TotalResources = count()
    by InitiativeName = tostring(split(policySetDefinitionId, "/")[-1])
| extend ComplianceRate = round((CompliantResources * 100.0) / TotalResources, 1)
| order by ComplianceRate asc
content.title: Policy Initiative Compliance Status

content.query:
Resources
| extend hasEnvironmentTag = isnotempty(tags["Environment"])
| extend hasCostCenterTag = isnotempty(tags["CostCenter"])  
| extend hasOwnerTag = isnotempty(tags["Owner"])
| where "{ResourceGroups}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| summarize 
    TotalResources = count(),
    WithEnvironmentTag = countif(hasEnvironmentTag),
    WithCostCenterTag = countif(hasCostCenterTag),
    WithOwnerTag = countif(hasOwnerTag)
    by resourceGroup
| extend 
    EnvironmentTagCompliance = round((WithEnvironmentTag * 100.0) / TotalResources, 1),
    CostCenterTagCompliance = round((WithCostCenterTag * 100.0) / TotalResources, 1),
    OwnerTagCompliance = round((WithOwnerTag * 100.0) / TotalResources, 1)
| order by EnvironmentTagCompliance desc
content.title: Resource Tagging Compliance by Resource Group

content.query:
PolicyResources
| where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates"
| where tostring(properties.complianceState) == "NonCompliant"
| extend 
    resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
    policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policyDefinitionName = tostring(split(properties.policyDefinitionId, "/")[-1]),
    resourceType = tostring(properties.resourceType)
| join kind=leftouter (
    Resources
    | project id, name, resourceGroup, location, type, tags
) on $left.resourceId == $right.id
| extend 
    ResourceDisplayName = coalesce(name, tostring(split(resourceId, "/")[-1])),
    PolicyLink = strcat("https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Policy/PolicyDetailBlade/definitionId/", url_encode(policyDefinitionId))
| project 
    ResourceName = ResourceDisplayName, 
    ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, 
    ResourceType = coalesce(type, resourceType), 
    PolicyViolation = policyDefinitionName, 
    Location = location,
    ResourceId = resourceId,
    PolicyLink = PolicyLink
| order by ResourceGroup, ResourceName
content.title: Non-Compliant Resources (Detailed View)

## 🔒 Security Officer Dashboard

**Focus: Security controls, threat detection, and risk management**

This section provides security-focused visibility with threat indicators, vulnerability status, and security configuration analysis.

**🔒 Microsoft Defender for Cloud Recommendations**

This chart shows security recommendations that require attention, filtered to show only **Unhealthy** (actionable) assessments by severity level. The numbers align with what you see in the Microsoft Defender for Cloud portal under Recommendations.

- **High Severity**: Critical security issues requiring immediate attention
- **Medium Severity**: Important security improvements to implement
- **Low Severity**: Security enhancements to consider when possible

*Note: Only shows recommendations requiring action, not all assessments.*

content.query:
SecurityResources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments"
| where tostring(properties.status.code) == "Unhealthy"
| extend 
    severity = tostring(properties.metadata.severity),
    assessmentName = tostring(properties.displayName),
    resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceDetails.id)
| where isnotempty(severity)
| summarize RecommendationCount = count() by severity
| order by case(severity == "High", 1, severity == "Medium", 2, severity == "Low", 3, 4)
content.title: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Recommendations by Severity

content.json:
**🛡️ Security Posture Overview**

This metric shows your organization's overall security health based on Microsoft Defender for Cloud assessments:

- **Security Percentage**: Calculated as (Healthy Resources ÷ Total Evaluated Resources) × 100
- **Healthy Resources**: Resources that pass security assessments (shown in green)
- **Recommendations**: Number of security issues requiring attention (actionable items)

**Example**: 42.7% means 344 resources are secure out of 805 total assessed resources (344 + 461)

**Target Ranges:**
- **90%+**: Excellent security posture
- **75-89%**: Good security, minor improvements needed
- **60-74%**: Moderate risk, remediation recommended
- **<60%**: High risk, immediate action required

content.query:
SecurityResources
| where type == "microsoft.security/assessments"
| extend status = tostring(properties.status.code)
| summarize 
    TotalAssessments = count(),
    HealthyResources = countif(status == "Healthy"),
    UnhealthyRecommendations = countif(status == "Unhealthy"),
    NotApplicable = countif(status == "NotApplicable")
| extend ComplianceRate = round((HealthyResources * 100.0) / (HealthyResources + UnhealthyRecommendations), 1)
| project ComplianceRate, UnhealthyRecommendations, HealthyResources, TotalAssessments
content.title: Security Posture Overview

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.network/networksecuritygroups"
| extend nsgRules = properties.securityRules
| mvexpand nsgRules
| extend 
    ruleName = tostring(nsgRules.name),
    access = tostring(nsgRules.properties.access),
    direction = tostring(nsgRules.properties.direction),
    sourceAddressPrefix = tostring(nsgRules.properties.sourceAddressPrefix),
    destinationPortRange = tostring(nsgRules.properties.destinationPortRange)
| where access == "Allow" and direction == "Inbound" 
| where sourceAddressPrefix == "*" or sourceAddressPrefix == "Internet"
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| project NSGName = name, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, RuleName = ruleName, DestinationPort = destinationPortRange, SourcePrefix = sourceAddressPrefix
| order by NSGName
content.title: High-Risk Network Security Group Rules (Internet-Facing)

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.network/publicipaddresses"
| extend 
    ipAddress = tostring(properties.ipAddress),
    allocationMethod = tostring(properties.publicIPAllocationMethod),
    associatedResource = tostring(properties.ipConfiguration.id)
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| project PublicIPName = name, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, IPAddress = ipAddress, AllocationMethod = allocationMethod, AssociatedResource = associatedResource, Location = location
| order by ResourceGroup
content.title: Public IP Address Inventory

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.storage/storageaccounts"
| extend 
    httpsTrafficOnly = tostring(properties.supportsHttpsTrafficOnly),
    minimumTlsVersion = tostring(properties.minimumTlsVersion),
    allowBlobPublicAccess = tostring(properties.allowBlobPublicAccess),
    encryption = tostring(properties.encryption.services.blob.enabled)
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| project 
    StorageAccount = name, 
    ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, 
    HTTPSOnly = httpsTrafficOnly, 
    MinTLSVersion = minimumTlsVersion, 
    PublicBlobAccess = allowBlobPublicAccess, 
    BlobEncryption = encryption,
    Location = location
| order by StorageAccount
content.title: Storage Account Security Configuration

content.json:
## ⚙️ Cloud Engineer Dashboard

**Focus: Implementation, automation, and technical optimization**

This section provides operational insights with resource health, configuration analysis, and optimization opportunities.

**📊 Resource Distribution by Resource Group**

This chart shows the number of Azure resources deployed in each Resource Group across your subscriptions. It helps identify:

- **Resource concentration**: Which groups have the most resources
- **Organizational patterns**: How resources are grouped by teams/projects
- **Management complexity**: Groups with high resource counts may need subdivision
- **Cost allocation**: Resource density correlates with potential costs

Use this data for capacity planning, cost management, and organizational governance.

content.query:
Resources
| summarize 
    ResourceCount = count(),
    UniqueTypes = dcount(type),
    UniqueLocations = dcount(location)
    by resourceGroup, subscriptionId
| extend SubscriptionName = tostring(split(subscriptionId, "/")[-1])
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| order by ResourceCount desc
content.title: Resource Distribution by Resource Group

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| extend 
    vmSize = tostring(properties.hardwareProfile.vmSize),
    osType = tostring(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType),
    managedDisk = isnotempty(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.managedDisk),
    diagnosticsEnabled = isnotempty(properties.diagnosticsProfile)
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| project VMName = name, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, VMSize = vmSize, OSType = osType, ManagedDisk = managedDisk, DiagnosticsEnabled = diagnosticsEnabled, Location = location
| order by ResourceGroup, VMName
content.title: Virtual Machine Configuration Analysis

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.storage/storageaccounts"
| extend 
    sku = tostring(properties.sku.name),
    kind = tostring(properties.kind),
    accessTier = tostring(properties.accessTier)
| extend replication = case(
        sku contains "LRS", "Locally Redundant",
        sku contains "GRS", "Geo Redundant", 
        sku contains "ZRS", "Zone Redundant",
        "Other"
    )
| where "{ResourceGroups}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| summarize StorageCount = count() by sku, replication
| order by StorageCount desc
content.title: Storage Account Configuration Summary

content.json:
**Storage Account Distribution Analysis**

This chart shows the distribution of storage accounts by SKU type and replication settings. It helps identify optimization opportunities and ensure appropriate redundancy levels are configured across your environment.

content.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.network/virtualnetworks"
| extend addressSpace = properties.addressSpace.addressPrefixes
| mvexpand addressSpace
| extend 
    vnetName = name,
    cidr = tostring(addressSpace),
    subnets = array_length(properties.subnets)
| where "{ResourceGroups:escape}" == "value::all" or resourceGroup in ({ResourceGroups})
| project VNetName = vnetName, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, CIDR = cidr, SubnetCount = subnets, Location = location
| order by ResourceGroup, VNetName
content.title: Virtual Network Topology Overview

content.query:
HealthResources
| where type == "microsoft.resourcehealth/availabilitystatuses"
| extend 
    resourceId = tostring(properties.targetResourceId),
    availabilityState = tostring(properties.availabilityState),
    reasonType = tostring(properties.reasonType)
| summarize count() by availabilityState, reasonType
| order by availabilityState
content.title: Resource Health Status Overview
